name: Satisfactory progress in treatment program as mitigating factor
text: [§353G-12]  Satisfactory progress in treatment program as mitigating factor.  A person's satisfactory progress in a treatment program as determined by the treatment program's report shall be considered a mitigating factor and evidence of the person's amenability to treatment for purposes of determining the terms and conditions of parole or other release from a correctional center or facility. [L 1998, c 152, pt of §2]
